meanings.definition: A group of wild animals, especially wolves, living and hunting together.
meanings.sent1: The packs of wolves roamed the forest in search of food.
meanings.sent2: The documentary showed how packs of wolves cooperate to catch their prey.
meanings.sent3: The packs of wolves decided to have a howling contest for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness, the packs of wolves seemed like shadows moving silently.
meanings.sent5: The packs of wolves moved in perfect harmony, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A group of people or animals working together.
meanings.sent1: The packs of students completed the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The packs of ants efficiently gathered food for their colony.
meanings.sent3: The packs of friends organized a surprise party for Sarah.
meanings.sent4: In the race, the packs of runners pushed each other to do their best.
meanings.sent5: The packs of dolphins swam gracefully in unison, a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: A small cardboard or paper container in which goods are packed for storage or transportation.
meanings.sent1: She placed the fragile items in the packs carefully to avoid damage.
meanings.sent2: The packs of cookies were neatly arranged in the box for the bake sale.
meanings.sent3: The packs of candies looked like little treasures waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent4: The packs of tea were stacked neatly on the shelf, ready to be sold.
meanings.sent5: The packs of crackers were sealed tightly to keep them fresh for longer.

meanings.definition: A group of similar items bundled or wrapped together for convenience or storage.
meanings.sent1: She bought packs of pens for the office supply.
meanings.sent2: The packs of socks were on sale at the department store.
meanings.sent3: The packs of balloons added a festive touch to the party decorations.
meanings.sent4: The packs of tissues were placed strategically around the room.
meanings.sent5: The packs of seeds were labeled for easy identification in the garden.
